conbody.p: The data elements stored in can be queried in a number of ways. You can contructs datasets using any available data element, across multiple and disparate data collections.

Datasets are virtual constructs that can be created in advance or on demand and altered whenever circumstances demand. Datasets are instantiated only when executed. It is not necessary to predefine the data needed or to navigate a complex database schema. Datasets can bring together any subset of the digital assets in the system, across any data collection of any format or type. Because all data is indexed and cataloged in advance, dataset execution is fast.

The Policy Enforcement Engine mediates all requests for data. Users or exporters can only access data based on data privacy tags, user authorizations, and access policies, so access to data remains governance-compliant at all times.
Datasets can be be executed directly by users and downloaded or exported to spreadsheets, applications, or analytics tools. Export can occur in a variety of ways:

li.p: To a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet or to a Comma Separated Value (CSV) file
To a custom application via the PHEMI
To applications and analytics tools via ODBC/JDBC connectors
To SAP HANA via the SAP Smart Data Access connector
